Retrieve the language file that never ma: Retrieve the language file that never made it into production.
Brute force is not the only option for t: Brute force is not the only option for this challenge, but a perfectly viable one.
Get rid of all 5-star customer feedback.
Once you found admin section of the appl: Once you found admin section of the application, this challenge is almost trivial.
Forge a coupon code that gives you a dis: Forge a coupon code that gives you a discount of at least 80%.
Try either a) a knowledgable brute force: Try either a) a knowledgable brute force attack or b) reverse engineering or c) some research in the cloud.
Post some feedback in another users name: Post some feedback in another users name.
You can solve this by tampering with the: You can solve this by tampering with the user interface or by intercepting the communication with the RESTful backend.
Post a product review as another user or: Post a product review as another user or edit any user's existing review.
Observe the flow of product review posti: Observe the flow of product review posting and editing and see if you can exploit it.
Forge an almost properly RSA-signed JWT: Forge an almost properly RSA-signed JWT token that impersonates the (non-existing) user rsa_lord@juice-sh.op.
This challenge is explicitly not about a: This challenge is explicitly not about acquiring the RSA private key used for JWT signing.
Access a developer's forgotten backup fi: Access a developer's forgotten backup file.
You need to trick a security mechanism i: You need to trick a security mechanism into thinking that the file you want has a valid file type.
Access a salesman's forgotten backup fil: Access a salesman's forgotten backup file.
<a href=\"/#/contact\">Inform the shop</: Inform the shop about a typosquatting imposter that dug itself deep into the frontend. (Mention the exact name of the culprit)
This challenge has nothing to do with mi: This challenge has nothing to do with mistyping web domains. There is no conveniently misplaced file helping you with this one either. Or is there?
Log in with Chris' erased user account.
Turns out that something is technically: Turns out that something is technically and legally wrong with the implementation of the "right to be forgotten" for users.
Steal someone else's personal data witho: Steal someone else's personal data without using Injection.
Trick the regular Data Export to give yo: Trick the regular Data Export to give you more than actually belongs to you.

Finding a piece of displayed information: Finding a piece of displayed information that could originate from an HTTP header is part of this challenge.
Solve challenge #999. Unfortunately, thi: Solve challenge #999. Unfortunately, this challenge does not exist.
You need to trick the hacking progress p: You need to trick the hacking progress persistence feature into thinking you solved challenge #999.

Identify an unsafe product that was remo: Identify an unsafe product that was removed from the shop and inform the shop which ingredients are dangerous.
Your own SQLi and someone else's Ctrl-V: Your own SQLi and someone else's Ctrl-V will be your accomplices in this challenge!

Log in with the administrator's user acc: Log in with the administrator's user account.
Try different SQL Injection attack patte: Try different SQL Injection attack patterns depending whether you know the admin's email address or not.
Log in with Amy's original user credenti: Log in with Amy's original user credentials. (This could take 93.83 billion trillion trillion centuries to brute force, but luckily she did not read the "One Important Final Note")
This challenge will make you go after a: This challenge will make you go after a needle in a haystack.
Log in with Bender's user account.
If you know Bender's email address, try: If you know Bender's email address, try SQL Injection. Bender's password hash might not help you very much.
Log in with Bjoern's Gmail account <i>wi: Log in with Bjoern's Gmail account without previously changing his password, applying SQL Injection, or hacking his Google account.
The security flaw behind this challenge: The security flaw behind this challenge is 100% OWASP Juice Shop's fault and 0% Google's.
Exploit OAuth 2.0 to log in with the Chi: Exploit OAuth 2.0 to log in with the Chief Information Security Officer's user account.
Don't try to beat Google's OAuth 2.0 ser: Don't try to beat Google's OAuth 2.0 service. Rather investigate implementation flaws on OWASP Juice Shop's end.
Log in with Jim's user account.
Try cracking Jim's password hash if you: Try cracking Jim's password hash if you harvested it already. Alternatively, if you know Jim's email address, try SQL Injection.
Log in with MC SafeSearch's original use: Log in with MC SafeSearch's original user credentials without applying SQL Injection or any other bypass.
You should listen to MC's hit song \"Pro: You should listen to MC's hit song "Protect Ya Passwordz".
Log in with the support team's original: Log in with the support team's original user credentials without applying SQL Injection or any other bypass.
The underlying flaw of this challenge is: The underlying flaw of this challenge is a lot more human error than technical weakness.
Put an additional product into another u: Put an additional product into another user's shopping basket.
Have an eye on the HTTP traffic while pl: Have an eye on the HTTP traffic while placing products in the shopping basket. Changing the quantity of products already in the basket doesn't count.
Like any review at least three times as: Like any review at least three times as the same user.
Punctuality is the politeness of kings.
Apply some advanced cryptanalysis to fin: Apply some advanced cryptanalysis to find the real easter egg.
You might have to peel through several l: You might have to peel through several layers of tough-as-nails encryption for this challenge.
Let the server sleep for some time. (It: Let the server sleep for some time. (It has done more than enough hard work for you)
This challenge is essentially a stripped: This challenge is essentially a stripped-down Denial of Service (DoS) attack.
All your orders are belong to us! Even t: All your orders are belong to us! Even the ones which don't.
Take a close look on how the $where quer: Take a close look on how the $where query operator works in MongoDB.
Update multiple product reviews at the s: Update multiple product reviews at the same time.
Take a close look on how the equivalent: Take a close look on how the equivalent of UPDATE-statements in MongoDB work.
Let us redirect you to one of our crypto: Let us redirect you to one of our crypto currency addresses which are not promoted any longer.
We might have failed to take this out of: We might have failed to take this out of our code properly.

Reset Jim's password via the <a href=\"/: Reset Jim's password via the Forgot Password mechanism with the original answer to his security question.

Request a hidden resource on server thro: Request a hidden resource on server through server.

The 2FA implementation requires to store: The 2FA implementation requires to store a secret for every user. You will need to find a way to access this secret in order to solve this challenge.

Upload a file larger than 100 kB.

Retrieve the content of <code>C:\\Window: Retrieve the content of C:\Windows\system.ini or /etc/passwd from the server.

It is not as easy as sending a large amo: It is not as easy as sending a large amount of data directly to the deprecated B2B interface.
